page.title: 09NEW ABBEY - HOME LIFE
page.content: On an ordinary morning I would rise at about 6.30am and have breakfast. I would leave the house at about 7.45 and arrive in school at 8.45 am, after a journey by car and bus. My favourite subjects at school are Biology and History, as I like animals and wildlife, and learning about the past. I like all of my subjects, but have a lot of homework in the evening. After school, when I arrive home I often go outside and help my father on the farm. Yesterday we were putting bales of silage into bags, before it gets too wet. On the farm I look after the pigs and help to feed the calves. At the moment we have about 60 pigs and piglets. On Wednesdays I go to the Girl Guide Unit in the Guild Hall at New Abbey, which I enjoy very much. I usually go to bed around 9.30 pm.
